alert.note: Alert for Mississippi; New Madrid; Scott (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 9:18PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Pulaski, west central Massac, central Alexander, Fulton, Carlisle, Hickman, Ballard, western McCracken, western Graves, Mississippi, eastern Scott and eastern New Madrid Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 916 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Mounds, Cairo, and Wyatt moving was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cairo and Wyatt around 920 PM CDT. Mounds and Mound City around 925 PM CDT. Hickman and Wickliffe around 930 PM CDT. Bardwell and Barlow around 935 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include La Center, Cayce, Lovelaceville, Fulton, Barkley Regional Airport and West Paducah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 15. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 3 and 21. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 1 and 14. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 48 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southern Illinois...and western Kentucky.
